snippet: Representatives of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s conservative bloc in Germany began a series of talks aimed at sounding out each side’s willingness to compromise.
abstract: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany and representatives of her conservative bloc begin first in series of exploratory talks with potential coalition partners, amid growing sense of urgency from all sides about danger of leaving Berlin rudderless for too long.
lead_paragraph: Representatives of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s conservative bloc in Germany began a series of talks aimed at sounding out each side’s willingness to compromise.

headline.main: Merkel’s Conservative Bloc Sounds Out Possible Partners
headline.print_headline: Merkel’s Conservative Bloc Sounds Out Possible Partners
